tweets.text:
@RussellB1ggs @The_WMA @EnvAgencyAnglia @Ruralpay ‚Ä¢ use tracks across the contour where possible
‚Ä¢ regularly divert run-off into field margins or soak away areas to prevent build-up of run-off down
slopes
‚Ä¢ reduce numbers on high risk steep slopes particularly in the winter
‚Ä¢ rotate to avoid severe compaction.

@RussellB1ggs @The_WMA @EnvAgencyAnglia @Ruralpay Taken from The Guide to Cross Compliance 2020: To limit soil erosion you can:
‚Ä¢ lay out paddocks so as not to channel run-off
‚Ä¢ move pigs onto well established grass
‚Ä¢ use large troughs to reduce soil damage
‚Ä¢ use grass strips to intercept run-off

@agricontract @EnvAgency We're predicting drier summers - where's your water storage going to be?
If we straighten and canalise watercourses, we reduce the overall length of the water channel and the area of its edge (where water drains in). We've made our own problem

@NrtSam @hslyfarms @Rosewood_Farm @billmero @agricontract @sunkfarmer @EnvAgency I'm really torn on this. Or confused. Appreciate that getting rid of water means there will be less in the soil come summer drought, but with no drainage at all, once land is completely saturated in winter, will it not go off the top, eroding soil with it?

urls.title: Is It Time for a Different Approach to Flooding?
urls.description: With all the rain that has fallen, it‚Äôs not surprising that over 400 flood warnings were issued throughout England last week. Within this context, a new study has been developed by North Yorkshire County Council and City of York Council which focuses on tackling flooding by working in partnership with upland landowners to allow their land to flood, thereby storing rainfall runoff and protecting properties in towns and villages downstream from flooding. Such schemes are often referred to as Natural Flood

tweets.text:
Phew! The rain has subsided‚Ä¶ but for how long? üíß

Last week the @EnvAgency issued over 400 flood warnings throughout England. Unfortunately, with #Flooding regularly hitting the news, is it time for a different approach? 

Keep on reading‚Ä¶ https://t.co/Zeed4n97b8 https://t.co/C4GEkfuYor
